question: 家
sourceAnswer:
<read>いえ</read>:: house/residence/dwelling | family/household | lineage/family-name
<read>うち</read>:: house | one's-house/one's-home/one's-family/one's-household
<read>け</read>:: house-(e.g.-of-Tokugawa)/family
sourceMnemonic: The kanji and the word are exactly the same. That means they share meanings as well.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
Since this word is made up of a single kanji, it should use the kun'yomi reading. When learning the kanji, you didn't learn that reading, so here's a mnemonic to help you with this word: 

What do you do in your <vocabulary>home</vocabulary>? You <reading>ea</reading>t <reading>e</reading>ggs (<ja>いえ</ja>), that's what. You eat eggs three times a day, every day. You really love eating eggs in your <vocabulary>house</vocabulary>!
